medical_history.chief_complaint: Progressive gait disturbance and stiffness in his legs.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient presented with a 5-year history of slowly progressive gait disorder characterized by clumsiness and unsteadiness during walking, along with stiffness and cramping pain in his legs. Symptoms have worsened over time, with increasing walking difficulties and leg pain reported at a 6-month follow-up. He also experiences erectile dysfunction and nocturia.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Past medical history includes hypogonadism diagnosed 1 year before the onset of the gait disorder, attributed to a bilateral orchiectomy due to a testicular tumor performed at age 37.
medical_history.family_history: Family medical history includes pes cavus in his mother and siblings; otherwise unremarkable.
